intro: Psychotria racemifera, commonly known as the "Bleeding Heart" or "Crimson Flame," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling a heart shape. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy texture, while the stems are woody and can grow up to several meters in height. Psychotria racemifera is also notable for its use in traditional medicine and its role in the ecosystem as a food source for various pollinators.
